thread.title: H.S. CROSS COUNTRY ROUNDUP: Hingham boys win division title
thread.title_full: H.S. CROSS COUNTRY ROUNDUP: Hingham boys win division title

author: Staff reports
title: H.S. CROSS COUNTRY ROUNDUP: Hingham boys win division title
text: Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 12:17 AM Updated at 12:25 AM Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 12:17 AM Updated at 12:25 AM The Hingham High boys cross country team clinched its second straight Patriot League Keenan Division championship by beating Whitman-Hanson, 21-39, at home on Tuesday. Mike Durkin won the 2.88-mile race in 15:04 for the Harbormen (7-0). He was one of 10 Hingham runners who finished in under 17 minutes. Ivan Frantz was second (15:23), Evan Goddard was fifth (15:41) and Liam Nolan finished sixth (15:42). Other strong runners for Hingham included Jack Muldoon (7th, 15:49), Pete Ross (9th, 15:59), Scott Meyers (13th, 16:46) and Jack Papich (14th, 16:48). For Whitman-Hanson (6-1), junior captain Lukas Moscoso was third in 15:34, and sophomore Jack Ryan placed fourth in 15:40. Senior Patrick Duffey (8th, 15:53), senior captain Sam Evans (10th, 16:17) and junior Bryce Pulkinen (11th, 16:23) also ran well and scored for Whitman-Hanson. *** The Hingham girls also topped Whitman-Hanson, 27-32. Samantha Coletti won the 2.88-mile race for the visiting Panthers (5-2), but Hingham (6-1) took seven of the other nine spots in the top 10. Starring for Hingham were: Kiley Aymar (2nd, 18:33), Paige King (4th, 18:43), Charlotte Ide (6th, 18:57), Severine Fortin (7th, 18:59), Kaylee Hill (8th, 19:50), Mary Koenen (9th, 19:59), and Jackie Harrington (10th, 20:08). Of the 42 Hingham girls that competed, 36 ran personal-bests for the season. Whitman-Hanson’s Abbie Newman was third in 18:42, and sophomore Nicole Norve was fifth in 18:44. In other high school cross action: BOYS CROSS COUNTRY BC High 19, Xaverian 42: The Eagles (4-0 Catholic Conference) claimed their league title. Colm Feeney (Braintree) finished first overall with a time of 17:10, and Joe Stover was third at 17:16. Silver Lake 20, Quincy 40; Silver Lake 19, Barnstable 36: James Cannon finished first overall for Quincy with a time of 16:09. Colin Boerger (16:33) was second overall and first for the Lakers, helping them sweep the tri-meet. Will Felix (17:13) was third overall, and P.J. Cook (17:20) finished fourth. Norwell 15, Randolph 50: The host Clippers swept the first seven spots, led by freshman Jacob Krivitsky, who won the 3.05-mile race in 18:46. Sophomore Nick Hoffman was runner-up in 19:08, followed by teammates Ryan Lynch (3rd, 19:10), Charlie O’Neal (4th, 19:35), Max Abbate (5th, 19:53), Andrew Bostrom (6th, 20:07) and Timmy Lynch (7th, 20:10). Middleboro 26, Scituate 29: Wells Culkins placed third, Chris Durante fifth and Trent Linker sixth for the Sailors in the loss on the road. Duxbury 22, Plymouth North 36: The Dragons defeated the Blue Eagles in a Patriot League meet. GIRLS CROSS COUNTRY Norwell def. Abington: The host Clippers swept the top three spots with Liz Sheedy (1st, 21:21 over 3 miles), Ellen Marchetti (2nd, 22:19) and Reilly Gilmour (3rd, 22:20). Also starring for Norwell were: Kryssa Mitchell (5th, 23:47), Rachel Bates (6th, 24:42) and Katie Punzak (7th, 25:45). Brianna Meideros was fourth for Abington in 23:30. Silver Lake 21, Quincy 37; Barnstable 28, Silver Lake 29: Abby Murphy was the overall winner for Quincy, posting a time of 20:07. Emma Wick finished second overall and first for the Lakers with a time of 20:33. Page 2 of 2 - Scituate 18, Middleboro 45: Katie Milligan was victorious for the Sailors. Claire Critchfield finished second and Mia Disano was fourth. Plymouth North 18, Duxbury 44: The Blue Eagles (7-0) clinched the Patriot League Keenan Division with a victory over the Dragons. By Staff reports
